name: middleware-manager
description: Middleware Manager is a self-hosted control panel for managing and monitoring middleware services in distributed environments. It offers a dashboard, logs, and integration with Kubernetes and cloud providers.
features: Service dashboard: Monitor health, status, and performance of middleware components across distributed infrastructure.
Log aggregation: Collect and search logs from multiple services in a centralized interface for faster debugging.
Configuration management: Update service settings and environment variables without direct server access or restarts.
Kubernetes integration: Deploy and manage middleware on K8s clusters with automated health checks and scaling.
Cloud provider support: Connect to AWS, Azure, and GCP to manage services across hybrid and multi-cloud environments.
Alert notifications: Receive warnings about service failures, resource limits, or performance degradation via email or webhooks.
Deployment history: Track configuration changes and rollbacks with audit logs showing who made changes and when.
API endpoints: Automate management tasks and integrate with CI/CD pipelines using REST API for programmatic control.
